definitions.definition: used in questions to ask somebody to be exact about one or more people or things from a limited number

examples.text: Which is better exercise—swimming or tennis?
Which way is the wind blowing?

definitions.definition: used to be exact about the thing or things that you mean

examples.text: Houses which overlook the lake cost more.
It was a crisis for which she was totally unprepared.

definitions.definition: used to give more information about something

examples.text: His best movie, which won several awards, was about the life of Gandhi.
Your claim ought to succeed, **in which case** the damages will be substantial.

definitions.definition: used to talk about recognizing the difference between one person or thing and another

examples.text: The twins are so alike I can't tell which is which.

wordOrigin: Old English hwilc, from the Germanic bases of who and alike.
